API_Description: Displays an alert dialog with a message, a help tip, and a title, and optionally stores a user preference.
API_Description_Reason: The method name 'alertWithHelp' suggests it displays an alert with additional help information. The parameters indicate it involves a message, a tip, a title, and a preference, which aligns with displaying a dialog with these elements.
Returns_Reason: Alert methods typically do not return a value; they perform an action (displaying a dialog) and do not need to return data.

cMsg.description: The main message to display in the alert dialog.
cMsg.description_reason: The parameter name 'cMsg' suggests it is the core message content of the alert.
cMsg.type_reason: Messages are typically represented as strings.

cTip.description: A help tip or additional information to display in the alert dialog.
cTip.description_reason: The parameter name 'cTip' implies it provides supplementary help or tips related to the alert.
cTip.type_reason: Tips or additional information are usually represented as strings.

cTitle.description: The title of the alert dialog.
cTitle.description_reason: The parameter name 'cTitle' indicates it is used as the title of the alert window.
cTitle.type_reason: Titles are typically represented as strings.

cPref.description: A user preference key to store or retrieve related to the alert.
cPref.description_reason: The parameter name 'cPref' suggests it is related to user preferences, possibly for storing or checking a setting.
cPref.type_reason: Preference keys are usually represented as strings.
